item.title: NPC Dialogue [Spelling? =\]
item.dc:creator: @Xbox_Modder Xbox Modder
item.description:
@Xbox_Modder wrote:

Ok… First to start, you have to add this somewhere under First Click Npc

else if (NPCID == MPCID) // NPC Name for quick reference { skillX = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].absX; skillY = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].absY; NpcWanneTalk = ****; // I suggest using the NPc Id but you can use whatever... }

Now, once you have added that, you have to add the first Dialouge sent to public void case40() with testscape
but it might just me case 40: in a different source…

Anyway, you should see something like this

if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 5  || NpcDialogue == 40 || NpcDialogue == 42 || NpcDialogue == 1001 || NpcDialogue == 1002 || NpcDialogue == 2259 || NpcDialogue == 2260 || NpcDialogue == 300) {

On the end just add

|| NpcDialogue == ****

Now where the stars are, they should match the stars from the code you added before that…

Now, we add what the person actually says…

Find

	public void UpdateNPCChat() {

I suggest you scroll down a bit but if you don;t becareful where you add it…

Anyway, you would add something like this…

case ****: //Should match the stars from before sendFrame126(GetNpcName(NpcTalkTo), 4902); sendFrame126("", 4903); sendFrame126("Hello, welcome to -scape!", 4904); //First line sendFrame126("", 4905); sendFrame126("", 4906); sendFrame75(NpcTalkTo, 4901); sendFrame164(4900); NpcDialogueSend = true; break;

Now, if you saved, compiled, and clicked that NPc ingame he would say that and nothing more…

If you want the player to get options from the NPC you would add something like this

case ****: // So if the **** from the beginning was 1000 this number would be 1001 sendFrame171(1, 2465); sendFrame171(0, 2468); sendFrame126("Select an Option", 2460); // Leave this alone sendFrame126("Thanks! I'll have fun!", 2461); //First option sendFrame126("Fuck off this server is as shitty as my diaper..", 2462); // Second option sendFrame164(2459); NpcDialogueSend = true; break;

Now if you went in game it you could click the NPC, then click to continue and you would get
the two above options… Of course they won’t do anything… Yet

So, say you want the first option to give them 1000 phats… You would find

case 9157:

Scroll down a little bit and you should see some codes…

If you want the first option to give them phats or something you would add this

}else if (NpcDialogue == ****) { //The Id of the stars with the options NpcDialogue = 0; NpcDialogueSend = false; sendMessage("Wow! Your cool! Here are some coins."); addItem(995, 1);

If you wanted the second option to disconnect them you would put…

}else if (NpcDialogue == ****) { //The Id of the stars with the options NpcDialogue = 1; NpcDialogueSend = false; sendMessage("Wow! Your cool! Here are some coins."); sendMessage("Rofl fag you wish cya"); disconnected = true;

Yea… Hope I helped… If I didn’t, just tell me…

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Dialogue [Spelling? =\]
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

T[quote=“Taylor John0, post:9, topic:92653”]geez guys
NPChandler.java

if (npcs[i].npcType == YOUR NPC ID) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "YOUR TEXT."; } }
change the npcType to ID of the NPC and change the text to what they say[/quote]his isnt realy what we are looking for.
we want it like this ::

NPC: Hello, i am NPC what can i help you with ?

Chose option: How do i make money?
How do i train skills?

If option = 1
Say: How do i make money.
[click here to continue]
NPC: Kill monsters or train smithing and sell items to players or shops.
[click here to continue]
Okay thanks.
[Close interface.]

If option =2
Say: How do i train my skills?
[Click here to contineu]
NPC: Klick the skill icons in the levels list and a popup
will show you what to do.
[Click here to coninue]
Say: Okay thanks.
[Click here to continue]
[Close interface.]

Well i hope that you understand what i am looking for i think Br3ndan is
loking for the same thing.
we just naad a short example or explanation about how to make sumtin like this.

Read full topic

change the npcType to ID of the NPC and change the text to what they say
